TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit BaseCompatibilityPreferences extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains properties that specify how an application should behave relative to new WPF features that are in the WindowsBase assembly.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether information about the <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.Priority%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is saved to the .
Docs.value: if information about the <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.Priority%2A> is saved to the ; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value of this property depends which version of WPF that your app targets. If your app targets WPF 4.0 or earlier, the default is `false`. If your app targets WPF 4.5, the default is `true`. If you use this property to change the behavior of WPF, you must change the property’s value early in the app’s lifetime, such in the constructor of the class that inherits from Application. After the value is read, you cannot change it again.

Docs.returns: if information about the <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.Priority%2A> is saved to the ; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext.Send%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method puts the delegates on the dispatcher queue or if the delegate is directly invoked.
Docs.value: if the <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext.Send%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method puts the delegates on the dispatcher queue or if the delegate is directly invoked; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value of this property depends which version of WPF that your app targets. If your app targets WPF 4.0 or earlier, the default is `false`. If your app targets WPF 4.5, the default is `true`. If you use this property to change the behavior of WPF, you must change the property’s value early in the app’s lifetime, such in the constructor of the class that inherits from Application. After the value is read, you cannot change it again.

Docs.returns: if the <xref:System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherSynchronizationContext.Send%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method puts the delegates on the dispatcher queue or if the delegate is directly invoked; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a single is used for multiple dispatcher operations.
Docs.value: true if a single is used for multiple dispatcher operations; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value of this property depends which version of WPF that your app targets. If your app targets WPF 4.0 or earlier, the default is `true`. If your app targets WPF 4.5, the default is `false`. If you use this property to change the behavior of WPF, you must change the property’s value early in the app’s lifetime, such in the constructor of the class that inherits from Application. After the value is read, you cannot change it again.

Docs.returns: true if a single is used for multiple dispatcher operations; otherwise, .
